page.title: 05The Tay Bridges
page.content: The principal features in this area and immediately to the west of this block are the road and rail bridges across the River Tay to the city of Dundee. The road bridge, which is a toll bridge despite objections, carries water gas and telephone wires from Dundee to Newport. It is sometimes damaged in winter by ice floating downstream. Before the bridges were built there were ferries going across the Tay. That was mainly why Newport was developed in the first place. There used to be a rail halt at the side of the rail bridge but it has been knocked down. There are proposals for a new one but it isn't likely to be built.
